triples.name: Information Retrieval
triples.relevance: Core task of web search and data mining conference, addressing how to identify and retrieve relevant information from large data sets.

triples.name: Data Mining
triples.relevance: Primary focus of the WSDM conference, extracting patterns from massive datasets through machine learning and statistical methods.

triples.name: Graph Neural Networks
triples.relevance: Featured as a keynote topic by George Karypis, representing recent advances in neural network architectures for graph-structured data.

triples.name: Knowledge Distillation
triples.relevance: Featured in Yejin Choi's keynote on symbolic knowledge distillation and commonsense reasoning applications.

triples.name: Commonsense Reasoning
triples.relevance: Key research area discussed in Yejin Choi's keynote, essential for AI systems to understand everyday situations like humans.

triples.name: Natural Language Processing
triples.relevance: Underlying task for processing multimodal and script knowledge as mentioned in the keynote on commonsense reasoning.

triples.name: Ethics of Artificial Intelligence
triples.relevance: Core theme addressed by Ricardo Baeza-Yates keynote on ethics challenges in AI, covering fairness, accountability, and transparency.

triples.name: Machine Learning
triples.relevance: Foundational discipline underlying web search, data mining, and all research methods discussed at the conference.
